quote: Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: Tonight I can write the saddest lines

quote: Tears shed for another person are not a sign of weakness. They are a sign of a pure heart.

quote: Tears are words that need to be written.

quote: When God Created Mothers"

quote: Don't cry over someone who wouldn't cry over you.

quote: there are two types of people in the world: those who prefer to be sad among others, and those who prefer to be sad alone.

quote: I can't eat and I can't sleep. I'm not doing well in terms of being a functional human, you know?

quote: Ho! Ho! Ho! To the bottle I go

quote: So it’s true, when all is said and done, grief is the price we pay for love.

quote: Ester asked why people are sad.

quote: Sigh no more, ladies, sigh no more,
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Nothing can cure the soul but the senses, just as nothing can cure the senses but the soul.

quote: I don’t know what they are called, the spaces between seconds– but I think of you always in those intervals.

quote: Percy, let me go" she croaked. "You can't pull me up."

quote: When you've suffered a great deal in life, each additional pain is both unbearable and trifling.

quote: I can write the saddest poem of all tonight.

quote: Someday, we’ll run into each other again, I know it.

quote: Tears, idle tears, I know not what they mean,

quote: I said uselessly, "Sam, don't go."

quote: The sadness will last forever.

quote: Some people are just not meant to be in this world. It's just too much for them.

quote: I am in that temper that if I were under water I would scarcely kick to come to the top.

quote: Issac:"I dislike living in a world without Augustus Waters."

quote: If you desire healing,
author: Rumi

quote: Suddenly this defeat.

quote: But what was there to say?

quote: the saddest thing is to be

quote: a flower knows, when its butterfly will return,
author: Sanober Khan

quote: It is beautiful, it is endless, it is full and yet seems empty. It hurts us.

quote: Laugh, and the world laughs with you;
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quote: I wish the night would end,

quote: It's OK not to be OK.

quote: Lie still, lie still, my breaking heart;

quote: And empty words are evil.

quote: I don't-" I shake my head. (...)

quote: Out of the starless night that covers me,

author: Tim Willocks

quote: He carries stars in his pockets

quote: Not a whit, we defy augury: there's a special

quote: Have I thought long to see this morning’s face,

quote: It's like a Venn diagram of tragedy.

quote: Utterly, irrevocably, lost
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: I have been poisoned in your love and now I need antidote Jacqueline.L.J! <3

quote: How little our careers express what lies in us, and yet how much time they take up. It's sad, really.

quote: It is such a secret place, the land of tears.

quote: I wanted to keep looking at her because I wanted to never take my eyes from her, but still I had to

quote: I often wish I'd got on better with your father,' he said.

quote: Never such innocence,
author: Philip Larkin

quote: It is sad that people need alcohol to make them happy.
author: Habeeb Akande

quote: Tears are a form of communication - like speech - and require a listener.

quote: Knowing the Techniques of Survival........
author: Sebastian K. Young

quote: Toward dawn we shared with you
author: Stanley Kunitz

quote: Someday, beyond the clouds and all the world's wrongs, there will be love, compassion and justice, and we shall all understand.
author: Flavia Weedn

quote: And a rock feels no pain;

author: Barney Stinson

quote: Tears are God's way of cleansing the heart.

quote: This is how sudden things happened that haunted forever.

quote: Empty teacups gathered around her and dictionary pages fell at her feet.

quote: He smiles sadly. "Now I know my destiny."

quote: ...sadness is a powerful foe, maybe harder to keep down than happiness...

quote: It wasn't the aloneness that Liz minded. It was the silence. It echoed.

quote: In search of Truth the hopeful zealot goes,
author: H.P. Lovecraft

quote: There is often grief that comes with loving, Moshe. But it is worth it.

quote: He tried not to cry as he wondered if he would ever have a home again.

quote: sad things are beautiful only from a distance

quote: there are many reasons to be sad.

quote: ...to make art is to realize another's sadness within, realize the hidden sadness in other people's lives, to feel sad with and for a stranger.

quote: He had the same look on his face that I had every day when I looked in the mirror. He was nothing more than a shell of a person.

quote: No one can usurp the heights...
author: John Keats

quote: Here is a minute. It may be my love is dead, but here is a minute to kneel over the grave and pray by it.
author: William Makepeace Thackeray

quote: Idyllic memories are merely a jeweled noose.
author: Orlando Ricardo Menes

quote: No child should ever be too sad to play.
author: Andrew Galasetti

quote: As she looks through the window;
author: J.B.

quote: The amusements of life, he argued, should be accepted with the same philosophy as its ills. ("The Striding Place")

quote: You might want someone else to save you, or might want to save someone so badly. But no one else can save you, not really, not from yourself.

quote: Although
author: Izumi Shikibu

quote: Cry as much as you want to, but make sure when you're finished, you never cry for the same reason again
author: Wiz Khalifa

quote: It's not reasonable to love people who are only going to die.

quote: my life is just waiting for you to get started.
author: Nina LaCour

quote: Ah! The anguish, the vile rage, the despair

quote: A mist is rolling over the fields. Why is a summer mist romantic and autumn mist just sad?

quote: That’s what I’m trying, sir… getting my life.
author: Faraaz Kazi

quote: Is there anything sadder than the scrawniest little piece of uneaten chicken at a dinner party?

quote: As if one's capacity for pain had anything to do with life's apportionment of agonies, Mr. Kimmelbrod thought. Such idiocy.

author: Vineet Raj Kapoor

author: Anthony T.Hincks

quote: I couldn’t even tell if I had any sadness of my own, because I was so full of Abuelita’s sadness.

quote: All the dreams I'd allowed myself to imagine were nothing but pages swept away by the wind.
author: Freedom Matthews

quote: I'm looking at the ruins of my own existence and knowing, with a sickening certainty, that my old home and my old life have been truly destroyed.

quote: On that search for happiness we did nothing with all those other emotions that made us human.
author: Darnell Lamont Walker

quote: Mearth appeared angry and disappointed briefly, but then she just gazed at the ground. “…It must be horrible, feeling all alone, is it?” she asked.
author: Rebecca McNutt

quote: As the days dwindled towards the end of the week I knew only one thing: I couldn't return to our old life.
author: Ruth Ahmed

quote: i know you will come back to me one day,
author: Nabil TOUSSI

quote: Within sadness lives a happiness deeper than any pain.
author: Cathryn Alpert

quote: I sit on a rock and watch children playing
author: Adelheid Manefeldt

quote: When Your Smile At Someone's Misery, Its Does Not Shows Your Tolerance. Its Reveals lack of Tears For Feeling.
author: Yaganesh Derasari

quote: I don't think you feel much of anything anymore.
author: Catherine Ryan Hyde

quote: ...maybe, in the face of abandonment, we are all the same; maybe not even a very orderly mind can endure the discovery of not being loved.
author: Elena Ferrante

quote: I'd never known that I could feel this broken and whole at once.

quote: People aren't born sad.

quote: Sometimes I return back to the state of mind I had as a child when I believed nothing was impossible.

quote: My beautiful swan. My savior and my undoing.

quote: Isn't it ironic that when you accept sadness is an inevitability of the human condition you feel happier?

quote: All's taken away: my love and my power.
author: Anna Akhmatova

quote: MARCUS ANDRONICUS: Now is a time to storm; why art thou still?
author: William Shakespeare

quote: The perennial sadness of a girl who is both death and the maiden.
author: Angela Carter

quote: Why did you revive me?” Alecto repeated.
author: Rebecca McNutt

quote: I loved you, I trusted you, but you lied to me, deceived my heart and poisoned my life.
author: blank text

quote: If Molly had not been so entirely loyal to her friend, she might have
author: Elizabeth Gaskell

quote: She's too sad to be beautiful. No one that sad can still be beautiful.
author: Paul Auster

quote: Her eyes are liquid and draining out of her.
author: Marianne Curley

quote: ...not to look back or feel sad about things, that home is wherever I am.
author: Donna Tartt

quote: Nothing is more painful than the loneliness of being with someone who is never completely there.
author: Rick Yancey

quote: Cursed the crown that brought such grief to me
author: J. Leigh Bralick

quote: There lives a weeper
author: Munia Khan

quote: Ever since the other boy had arrived half way through the semester, he'd been so blue, he was practically iridescent.
author: Lauren Groff

quote: I'll love you even when I can't"
author: Colleen Hoover

quote: I stood in your doorway this morning
author: Charlotte Eriksson

quote: The window of her sadness was so vast that it almost opened a path to her soul.
author: Ondjaki

quote: What a wonderful sadness to miss the one you have loved forever, it seems, and know that she is waiting at home.

quote: Allow your hearts to be driven by principle, not bias. Love, not hate. Unity, not division. The fire of your dreams, not the rain of your sorrows.

quote: When a human being is born the first thing he does is crying..
author: Erik Tanghe

quote: No matter how great the love, the pain, the sadness, the power of a heart, no one can recreate the sea. Nowhere else.
author: Ondjaki

quote: There's no saving him from his deep hole. There's no saving me from my black slug.
author: Jasmine Warga

quote: Spiritual awakening is an identity shift. You are God!
author: Erin Fall Haskell

quote: I wanted to cry so bad, but my tears are inside. A blindfold keeps them there. I can’t see today. Patti, I don’t know anything.

quote: They're going to get the death penalty. They'll be strung up and made to be laughed at out in the streets and made examples of!
author: Brad McKinniss

quote: He felt, in a way so familiar as to be almost dreary, the chosen victim of the gods, the self-admitted traitor, the one destined for judgment.

quote: I don't know any sad songs. Except for the funny ones.

quote: You can't get out of life alive, so you may as well have a good time.
author: Les Brown

quote: She rode toward the sunset
author: Rebecca Rijsdijk

quote: There are few things more ungodly than fake joy when you should be mourning.

quote: He had a powerful kind of ache inside of him, half joy, half terrible sadness.

quote: I have these knives in my chest that can't become words.

quote: It's funny to think that Christmas — a time known for its joyful togetherness — can be the loneliest time of the year for some.

quote: I can hear my mom.

quote: Do not think that I am not sad, though I laugh.

quote: If you have never known happiness and sorrow, then you have not fully experience life.

quote: until it is taken out of your mind, it is never lost and it is never gone
author: Ernest Agyemang Yeboah

quote: The winds shook off in unison and yipped beneath the gleaming stars.
author: Ali Shaw

quote: Let it go and learn from the process.
author: NASH

quote: There must be some atom of our life hidden here, lingering in this quiet somewhere.
author: Sonali Deraniyagala

quote: Always give but never expect. Giving is happiness; disappointment is sadness.

quote: She resents the chipped paint of the table and the dingy closet they call a dressing room. (Dark City Lights)

quote: Sadness comes from expectations. To be happy, adapt to everything and expect nothing.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: She shuffled with her head bowed, her dark eyes drifting to avoid contact, and she screamed in bed at night. (Dark City Lights)
author: Jim Fusilli

quote: Be compassionate; bring joy to sadness.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Do you found a new companion?
author: Nabil TOUSSI

quote: do not cry , you can focus the light spot with the eyes , the eyes of your heart . smile
author: Mister One

quote: What I want to know is how you go on when you look around
author: Charlotte Eriksson

quote: It was quite a sad thing,
author: Charlotte Eriksson

quote: Sadness is a bruise on the skin of memory.
author: John Mark Green

quote: She was a tragic beauty. Sadness had left its fingerprints all over her face.
author: John Mark Green

quote: Frightened people live in their own special hell.
author: Stephen King

quote: I walk these lonely streets at dark. Just me and the night; crowded head, empty heart.
author: John Mark Green

quote: If this constant bitter disappointment was love, then I was perfectly fine not to have anything to do with it.
author: Vann Chow

quote: How much pain a person detains may be proportionate to the pain they spare others when they'd rather hurt than hurt another.

quote: Unfortunately, the most significant moments of our lives are often unpleasant.
author: Andrea Cremer

quote: He knew too well the sting of loneliness and how over time it stole you away, piece by piece, until a mere shell remained.

quote: I kiss your tear-stained cheeks, tasting the saltiness of a hidden sea of sorrow.

quote: When sorrow's cup is filled up to the brim,the slightest touch of memory can cause tears to spill again.
author: John Mark Green

quote: She's in trouble, but I envy her.
author: Denice Envall

quote: . . . if there was a hope of comfort for any moment, the heart or head of no human being in this house could yield it . . .
author: Charlotte Brontë

quote: Mourn with those who are sorrowful.
author: Lailah Gifty Akita

quote: Either way, the view stabbed its way into his chest, as if it were trying to finish him off before he even landed.
author: Seré Prince Halverson

quote: Like the shadow of death
author: Nomzamo Nhlumayo

quote: It was lonely to be so perfect in all respects.
author: Vann Chow

quote: Look at the longing, the anguish of a sad fossil world / that cannot find the accent of its first sob.
author: Federico García Lorca

quote: Loving her was heaven that turned to hell when she died.
author: Jonathon Scott Fuqua

quote: There's no shame in honest suffering, my dear.
author: Andrea Cremer

quote: Be not in despair; let those tears of sadness grow into flowers.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: The deepest wretchedness often results from a perpetual continuation of petty trials.
author: L. G. Abell

quote: No more crying. Tears only cause destructive
author: Katherine Russell

quote: I met death for the last time realizing that he, the creature I called, it because I did not want to believe came for me... Collecting.
author: Jessica Reader

quote: There I was, casually wishing that I could stop existing in the same way you'd want to leave an empty room or mute an unbearably repetitive noise.
author: Allie Brosh

quote: I wish R.I.P meant Return If Possible...
author: A Friend of Yours

quote: I said I love you
author: Sade Andria Zabala

quote: Depression is our way of telling ourselves that something is seriously wrong and needs working through and changing.
author: Neel Burton

quote: And truths, these days, are spoken
author: Sanhita Baruah

quote: Depression is not always feeling sad. Most of the time it is feeling nothing.
author: Various

quote: In all you do, try being a WOW, and not a woe.
author: Anthony Liccione

quote: What made the difference between choosing to die and deciding to live?
author: Heidi R. Kling

quote: Never say you understand someone's pain if you haven't felt the same, because not only would you sound mocking but also ignorant.
author: Lolah Runda

quote: I said that " I love you ", and there's no responce from you.It's like i am eating a dark chocolate,too bitter
author: Carizza Bright

quote: In such moments of precious, invaluable misery, she rejoiced in tears of agony...
author: Jane Austen

quote: Things at the worst will cease, or else climb upward
author: William Shakespeare

quote: It's the same old story. A man came like the beautiful wind, left like a destructive storm.
author: Luan

quote: They talk about prohibition in America. What can one do in a country such as that?
author: Joseph Roth

quote: Sadness, it was such an arresting emotion. You could almost convince yourself of the rhyme and reason of heartbreak.
author: Anne Rice

quote: I’ve created the most beautiful things out of my sadness.
author: Anonymous
